fields.title: Stem Rot Precaution for Cotton
fields.description: Recent humid conditions combined with high temperatures have increased the risk of fungal diseases like stem rot in cotton crops in Maharashtra.
fields.recommendation: Improve field drainage and avoid waterlogging. Apply a recommended fungicide as a preventive measure. Remove and destroy any infected plants to prevent the spread of the disease.

fields.title: Early Fall Armyworm Detection in Rice
fields.description: Reports of Fall Armyworm larvae have been confirmed in several fields in Uttar Pradesh. These pests can cause significant damage to rice crops.
fields.recommendation: Conduct regular scouting for damaged leaves or visible larvae. If detected, apply an approved insecticide or bio-pesticide to control the population and prevent widespread infestation.

fields.title: Intense Heatwave Alert for Wheat Crops
fields.description: A severe heatwave is predicted to affect Punjab for the next 72 hours. High temperatures can cause heat stress in wheat plants and accelerate water loss from the soil.
fields.recommendation: Increase irrigation frequency during cooler hours (early morning or late evening). Use mulching to retain soil moisture and protect roots. Monitor crops for wilting and leaf scorch.

fields.title: Market Price Fluctuation for Chickpea
fields.description: The market for chickpea in Rajasthan is currently experiencing moderate fluctuations due to global supply and demand factors. Prices are expected to be volatile over the next few weeks.
fields.recommendation: Farmers holding stock should monitor daily market prices closely. Consider selling a portion of your stock if the price meets your target, and hold the remainder for a potential price increase.

fields.title: Post-Harvest Soil Preparation for Sugarcane
fields.description: As the current harvest for sugarcane in Karnataka nears completion, it's crucial to replenish the soil's nutrients for the next cycle.
fields.recommendation: After harvesting, collect soil samples and get them tested. Based on the results, apply organic manure or balanced fertilizers to ensure optimal soil health for the next planting season.
